summary:
12. The Council encourages international partners to help Guinea-Bissau control air traffic and surveillance of maritime security to combat drug trafficking and organized crime.

13. The Council encourages international partners to support Guinea-Bissau in combating transnational organized crime and to contribute to the UNIOGBIS Trust Fund.

14. The Council stresses the importance of combating drug trafficking for stability, and requests the Secretary-General to ensure UNIOGBIS has anti-drug expertise.

15. The Council commends the Special Representative's good offices role and invites the Secretary-General to reinforce UNIOGBIS' capacities.

16. The Council welcomes the international donor conference and encourages the international community to support Guinea-Bissau's development.

17. The Council welcomes Guinea-Bissau's efforts to prevent Ebola transmission and encourages continued efforts to develop national capacities.

18. The Council requests the Secretary-General to submit regular reports on the implementation of this resolution.

19. The Council decides to review sanctions measures in seven months.

20. The Council decides to remain seized of the matter.
